title: Pattern 1: Two Pointers
excerpt: Stop solving random problems. Learn how to use two pointers to reduce time complexity from O(n²) to O(n).

title: Two Sum II (Sorted)
excerpt: Given a sorted array, find two numbers that add up to a target using O(1) space.

title: Remove Duplicates from Sorted Array
excerpt: Given a sorted array, remove duplicates in-place and return the count of unique elements using O(1) space.

title: Squares of a Sorted Array
excerpt: Given a sorted array, return a new array of squares in sorted order using the Two Pointers technique.

title: Sort Colors (Dutch National Flag Problem)
excerpt: Given an array with values 0, 1, and 2, sort the array in-place using the Three Pointer (Dutch National Flag) approach without using any sorting function.

title: 3Sum
excerpt: Given an array of integers, find all unique triplets that sum to zero using sorting and the Two Pointers technique to achieve O(n²) time complexity.

title: 4Sum
excerpt: Given an array of integers and a target, find all unique quadruplets that sum to the target using sorting and the Two Pointers based K-Sum approach with O(n³) time complexity.

title: Sliding Window Pattern
excerpt: Sliding Window is a technique used to efficiently process subarrays or substrings by maintaining a moving window over contiguous elements, reducing time complexity from O(n²) to O(n).

title: Max Sum Subarray of Size K
excerpt: Given an array and an integer k, find the maximum sum of any contiguous subarray of size k using the Sliding Window technique with O(n) time complexity.

title: Minimum Size Subarray Sum
excerpt: Given a target and an array of positive integers, find the smallest contiguous subarray whose sum is at least the target using a dynamic Sliding Window approach in O(n) time.

title: Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters
excerpt: Given a string, find the length of the longest contiguous substring without repeating characters using a dynamic Sliding Window technique in O(n) time.

title: Fruit Into Baskets
excerpt: Given an array representing types of fruits, find the length of the longest contiguous subarray containing at most two distinct types using the Sliding Window technique in O(n) time.

title: Longest Repeating Character Replacement
excerpt: Given a string and an integer k, find the length of the longest substring that can be obtained by replacing at most k characters using the Sliding Window technique in O(n) time.

title: Permutation in String
excerpt: Given two strings, s1 and s2, determine if s2 contains a permutation of s1 using the Sliding Window technique in O(n) time.

title: Find All Anagrams in a String
excerpt: Given a string s and a pattern p, find all start indices of p's anagrams in s using the Sliding Window technique in O(n) time.

title: Minimum Window Substring
excerpt: Given two strings s and t, find the minimum window in s which contains all the characters of t using the Sliding Window technique in O(n) time.

title: Slow and Fast Pointer Pattern
excerpt: The Slow and Fast Pointer technique involves using two pointers that move at different speeds to solve problems related to linked lists and arrays, often reducing time complexity to O(n) with O(1) space.

title: Linked List Cycle Detection
excerpt: Given a linked list, determine if it has a cycle using the Slow and Fast Pointer technique in O(n) time and O(1) space.

title: Find the Middle of a Linked List
excerpt: Given a linked list, find the middle node using the Slow and Fast Pointer technique in O(n) time and O(1) space.

title: Happy Number
excerpt: Determine if a number is a happy number using the Slow and Fast Pointer technique to detect cycles in O(n) time and O(1) space.

title: Find the Duplicate Number
excerpt: Given an array containing n + 1 integers where each integer is between 1 and n, find the duplicate number using the Slow and Fast Pointer technique in O(n) time and O(1) space.

title: Palindrome Linked List
excerpt: Given a singly linked list, determine if it is a palindrome using the Slow and Fast Pointer technique in O(n) time and O(1) space.

title: Circlular Array Loop
excerpt: We are given a **circular array** where each value tells us how far to jump forward or backward. We must check if there exists a **valid cycle**.

title: Prefix Sum Pattern
excerpt: The Prefix Sum technique involves creating an auxiliary array where each element at index i represents the sum of elements from the start of the original array up to index i, enabling efficient range sum queries in O(1) time after O(n) preprocessing.

title: Find Pivot Index
excerpt: Given an array of integers, find the pivot index where the sum of the elements to the left is equal to the sum of the elements to the right using the Prefix Sum technique in O(n) time and O(1) space.

title: Range Sum Query - Immutable
excerpt: Given an array of integers, implement a class that can efficiently calculate the sum of elements between two given indices using the Prefix Sum technique in O(1) time after O(n) preprocessing.

title: Subarray Sum Equals K
excerpt: Given an array of integers and a target sum k, count the number of subarrays that sum to k using the Prefix Sum technique in O(n) time and O(n) space.

title: Subarrays Divisible by K
excerpt: Given an array of integers and an integer k, find the number of contiguous subarrays whose sum is divisible by k using the Prefix Sum technique in O(n) time and O(n) space.
